com.joliciel.talismane.tokeniser

Interface Tokeniser

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    PatternTokeniser

    public interface Tokeniser
    A Tokeniser splits a sentence up into tokens (parsing units).
    Author:
    Assaf Urieli

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes

      static class  Tokeniser.TokeniserType

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static Pattern SEPARATORS
      A list of possible separators for tokens.

    • Method Detail

      • tokeniseWithDecisions

        List<TokenisedAtomicTokenSequence> tokeniseWithDecisions(String text)
        Tokenise a given sentence. More specifically, return up to N most likely tokeniser decision sequences, each of which breaks up the sentence into a different a list of tokens. Note: we assume duplicate white-space has already been removed from the sentence prior to calling the tokenise method, e.g. multiple spaces have been replaced by a single space.
        Parameters:
        text - the sentence to be tokenised
        Returns:
        a List of up to n TokeniserDecisionTagSequence, ordered from most probable to least probable

      • tokeniseText

        TokenSequence tokeniseText(String text)
        Similar to tokenise(String), but returns only the best token sequence.
        Parameters:
        text -
        Returns:

      • tokenise

        List<TokenSequence> tokenise(String text)
        Similar to tokeniseWithDecisions(String), but returns the token sequences inferred from the decisions, rather than the list of decisions themselves.
        Parameters:
        text -
        Returns:

      • tokeniseWithDecisions

        List<TokenisedAtomicTokenSequence> tokeniseWithDecisions(Sentence sentence)
        Similar to tokeniseWithDecisions(String), but the text to be tokenised is contained within a Sentence object.
        Parameters:
        sentence -
        Returns:

      • tokenise

        List<TokenSequence> tokenise(Sentence sentence)
        Similar to tokeniseWithDecisions(Sentence), but returns the token sequences inferred from the decisions, rather than the list of decisions themselves.
        Returns:

      • getTokenSequenceFilters

        List<TokenSequenceFilter> getTokenSequenceFilters()
        Filters to be applied to the atomic token sequences, prior to tokenising. These filters will either add empty tokens at given places, or change the token text. Note that these filters will be applied to the token sequences produced by the tokeniser as well.
        Returns:

      • addTokenSequenceFilter

        void addTokenSequenceFilter(TokenSequenceFilter tokenSequenceFilter)
        See getTokenSequenceFilters().
        Parameters:
        tokenSequenceFilter -

      • getTokenFilters

        List<TokenFilter> getTokenFilters()
        Filters to be applied prior to breaking the sentence up into atomic token sequences - these filters will mark certain portions of the sentence as entire tokens, and the tokeniser will not take any decisions inside these. It still may join them to other atomic tokens, to create larger tokens.
        Returns:

      • addTokenFilter

        void addTokenFilter(TokenFilter filter)
        See getTokenFilters().
        Parameters:
        filter -

      • addObserver

        void addObserver(ClassificationObserver observer)
